properties.name: 15/01141/FL

properties.notes: Proposed demolition of public house and ancillary buildings/ structures and construction of 3 houses and 2 bungalows granted. The Council considers that the re-development of the site for five houses would not have an impact on the openness of the Green Belt compared to the existing use and occupation of the site. Another planning application for the proposed demolition of the public house and construction of 4 two storey four bed dwellings (18/00519/FL) was withdrawn in April 2019.

The site is therefore withdrawn from the register.

properties.name: 17/01162/FL

properties.name: 18/00596/FL
properties.site-address: Commercial Inn, Bridge Street, Pilsley, Chesterfield, S45 8HE
properties.notes: Proposed demolition of the existing Commercial Inn and construction of a purpose built residential care and nursing home refused in December 2018. Another planning application for the demolition and re-development for 10no one bedroom apartments withdrawn in March 2020 (20/00202/FL). Although the housing yield calculation of the Housing LAA would result in 3 dwellings, the site may be able to accommodate a higher yield of 5 dwellings. This is due to the fact that there is an existing building with two dwellings approved on site, a higher density in the surrounding area and the planning history with applications promoting 17 (16/00748/FL, withdrawn) or 20 dwellings (15/00623/FL, withdrawn) respectivley on site.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: 18/00613/FL
properties.site-address: Deans Foods Ltd Stocks Lane Duckmanton Chesterfield S44 5HZ
properties.notes: Former planning permission (13/00314/FL) for re-development of site for 27 two storey dwellings expired in Jan 2017 but principle of residential re-development established. Latest application for residential development of 32 dwellings withdrawn. There was no response from the applicant and it was therefore considered ‘finally disposed of’. The site is therefore withdrawn from the register.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: CX/1607
properties.site-address: Former Biwaters site, land off Derby Road, Clay Cross
properties.notes: Outline application for a mixed-use development, comprising: residential use (C3), employment-generating uses with employment (B1, B2, B8), local centre (A1, A2, A3, A4 and/or A5), hotel (C1) and/or care home (C2); with associated infrastructure (17/00666/OL) was approved for the whole site in August 2018. The masterplan identified four phases of residential development. Reserved Matters permission has been granted for three phases (1, 3 and 4a) and an application for phase 2 is currently pending. However, Phase 2 is on Greenfield land, therefore overall housing figure on pdl reduced to 669 dwellings. 95 out of 825 dwellings have been completed up to March 2020. |https://www.ne-derbyshire.gov.uk/documents/eb-hou6b-housing-sites-appendix-c/viewdocument

properties.name: ScD/2103
properties.site-address: Land at Former Coalite Works, Buttermilk Lane, Bolsover
properties.notes: Outline planning permission (14/00145/OL) for a 660 dwelling scheme for the re-development of the whole area with associated ancillary uses (local centre, a safeguarded area for a school, children's play areas, green spaces and a Local Habitat Area; time limit for development is before the expiration of 8 years from the date of the permission). This brownfield land represents only the north western part of the scheme in North East Derbyshire. Since planning permission was granted on site, the Government has confirmed proposals for the realignment of the proposed route for HS2, such that it runs through the eastern end of the Coalite site affecting residential development. The impact of this creates significant uncertainty for the approved scheme and the council cannot be confident that the housing development will come forward. However, in light of the proposed realignment of HS2 the developer has applied for an outline application for B1c, B2 and B8 uses (19/00925/OL) which has been conditionally approved on 18 May 2020.|https://www.ne-derbyshire.gov.uk/documents/eb-hou6b-housing-sites-appendix-c/viewdocument
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: WW/1610 (2)
properties.site-address: Former Avenue Coking Works site, Derby Road, Wingerworth
properties.notes: The reserved matters approval (16/00526/RM) is the first phase of re-development for 252 dwellings. This brownfield site is the central part of the larger Avenue Strategic Site which is a mixed-use redevelopment to comprise 13.4 ha of residential use providing 489 dwellings, 2.8 ha of commercial land for employment use, 1.8 ha of land for provision of a primary school, 0.4 ha of land for other community use and formal and informal play and recreation space (13/00386/OL). There have been 32 completions in 2019/20.|https://www.ne-derbyshire.gov.uk/documents/eb-hou6b-housing-sites-appendix-c/viewdocument
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority

The reserved matters approval is the first phase of re-development for 261 dwellings.. http://www.ne-derbyshire.gov.uk/index.php/your-council/document-library/local-plan-2001-2011-supplementary-documents/local-plan-documents-february-2017/1586-housing-sites-appendix-c-1
properties.ownership-status: owned by a public authority

properties.name: WW/2201a
properties.site-address: Mill Lane, Wingerworth
properties.notes: In Oct 2007, planning permission (05/01143/OL) granted for a mix of uses including residential units (C3), commercial development (B1) and industrial development (B2) but expired.
